U.S. businesses' fears range from outright piracy of their goods to the transfer of technological know-how that can be inevitable in joint ventures with Chinese companies. Sometimes Beijing mandates that foreign firms share technology, locate R&D in China and so forth, and the U.S. business community sees that as tying their hands when they go to China, said Kevin Gallagher , professor of international relations at Boston University.`` They say,` We'll do that for five years and then all of a sudden China will have its own competitor that looks just like us

starts making the 2011 Dodge Grand Caravan and Chrysler Town and Country this week.`` We need to completely rethink the minivan,'' CEO Sergio Marchionne said Tuesday at the Canadian plant where Chrysler's minivans are made. However, Mr Eric Schmidt reassured investors that he does not expect any`` material change'' in the way the company is run because`` we tend to agree on pretty much everything''.

Kirsten Gillibrand said Friday that she will sit on the Republican side of the House floor next to Barack Obama John Thune , R-S.D. This is just a symbol, but it sends an important message that although we may disagree on various issues, we all stand ready to work together and do what we believe is right for the country, Kirsten Gillibrand said in a statement.
